dt: {bc}an arrangement of the eight {d_link|diatonic|diatonic} notes or tones of an octave according to one of several fixed schemes of their intervals {dx_def}see {dxt|interval||2}{/dx_def}
{bc}a rhythmical {dx_def}see {dxt|rhythm||2}{/dx_def} scheme (as in 13th and 14th century music)
{bc}the modal {dx_def}see {dxt|modality||2}{/dx_def} form of the assertion or denial of a logical proposition
{bc}a particular form or variety of something
{bc}a possible, customary, or preferred way of doing something

dt.t: new {wi}modes{/wi} of experimentation had to be developed

dt: {bc}a manifestation {dx_def}see {dxt|manifestation||1}{/dx_def}, form, or arrangement of being
{bc}a particular form or manifestation of an underlying substance

dt.t: a device that changes display colors in night {wi}mode{/wi} to help reduce eyestrain

dt: {bc}the most frequent value of a set of data
{bc}a value of a {d_link|random variable|random variable} for which a function of probabilities {dx_def}see {dxt|probability||1}{/dx_def} defined on it achieves a relative maximum
{bc}any of various stationary vibration patterns of which an elastic body or oscillatory system is capable

dt.t: the vibration {wi}mode{/wi} of an airplane propeller blade

pt: {sc}method{/sc} {sc}mode{/sc} {sc}manner{/sc} {sc}way{/sc} {sc}fashion{/sc} {sc}system{/sc} mean the means taken or procedure followed in achieving an end. {sc}method{/sc} implies an orderly logical arrangement usually in steps.
{sc}mode{/sc} implies an order or course followed by custom, tradition, or personal preference.
{sc}manner{/sc} is close to {sc}mode{/sc} but may imply a procedure or method that is individual or distinctive.
{sc}way{/sc} is very general and may be used for any of the preceding words.

pt.t: has her own {it}way{/it} of doing things

pt: {sc}fashion{/sc} may suggest a peculiar or characteristic way of doing something.
{sc}system{/sc} suggests a fully developed or carefully formulated method often emphasizing rational orderliness.

et: Middle English {it}moede{/it}, from Latin {it}modus{/it} measure, manner, musical mode {ma}{mat|mete|}{/ma}
shortdef: an arrangement of the eight diatonic notes or tones of an octave according to one of several fixed schemes of their intervals
a rhythmical scheme (as in 13th and 14th century music)

dt: {bc}a prevailing fashion or style (as of dress or behavior)

pt: {sc}fashion{/sc} {sc}style{/sc} {sc}mode{/sc} {sc}vogue{/sc} {sc}fad{/sc} {sc}rage{/sc} {sc}craze{/sc} mean the usage accepted by those who want to be up-to-date. {sc}fashion{/sc} is the most general term and applies to any way of dressing, behaving, writing, or performing that is favored at any one time or place.
{sc}style{/sc} often implies a distinctive fashion adopted by people of taste.

pt.t: a media baron used to traveling in {it}style{/it}

pt: {sc}mode{/sc} suggests the fashion of the moment among those anxious to appear elegant and sophisticated.

pt.t: slim bodies are the {it}mode{/it} at this resort

pt: {sc}vogue{/sc} stresses the wide acceptance of a fashion.
{sc}fad{/sc} suggests caprice in taking up or in dropping a fashion.
{sc}rage{/sc} and {sc}craze{/sc} stress intense enthusiasm in adopting a fad.

pt.t: Cajun food was the {it}rage{/it} nearly everywhere for a time
crossword puzzles once seemed just a passing {it}craze{/it} but have lasted

shortdef: a prevailing fashion or style (as of dress or behavior)

dt: {bc}an operating mode for an electronic device (such as a mobile phone) in which the device does not connect to wireless networks and cannot send or receive communications (such as calls or text messages) or access the Internet but remains usable for other functions

dt.t: Today [in 2009], airlines may let passengers use newer-model cell phones in what's called {wi}{ldquo}airplane{rdquo} mode{/wi}, which essentially disables the transmission function so they can't make calls. … FAA guidance allows cell phone calls once the plane has landed and is taxiing to the gate.
Now, I do all I can to ensure that I have a calm and productive morning. I keep my phone in the kitchen overnight, often not turning it off {wi}airplane mode{/wi} until I start work.

shortdef: an operating mode for an electronic device (such as a mobile phone) in which the device does not connect to wireless networks and cannot send or receive communications (such as calls or text messages) or access the Internet but remains usable for other functions

dt: {bc}a digital network communications system that allows high-speed broadband transmissions

dt.t: The overhaul of AT&T's network is just as important. AT&T will deploy an Internet-like digital technology known as ATM, for {wi}asynchronous transfer mode{/wi}. It converts information into the ones and zeros of computer language, breaks it into tiny pieces, stamps them with an address and sends them into a shared transmission line.

shortdef: a digital network communications system that allows high-speed broadband transmissions —abbreviation ATM

dt: {bc}one of eight scales prevalent in medieval music each utilizing a different pattern of intervals and beginning on a different tone

shortdef: one of eight scales prevalent in medieval music each utilizing a different pattern of intervals and beginning on a different tone
